pros: It is a small college and due to where they are located, they tend to pay better.
cons: The university is too focused on saving money and not on its core area, which is student success. The area itself is dying and many employees live in Houston, and Lamar itself has been struggling for a while. They have taken an approach that mimics large schools like UH which is to their detriment, as students suffer from courses that are overfilled and low quality. Too much pressure is put on faculty to do things that are outside of their core job for the university.

pros:
Experience of Industry:
Teaches Money Handling:
Helps Making Strong Connections:
Makes Responsive:
cons:
1. Distraction from Studies:

Working along with studies consumes your time. It can distract you from your studies which can lead to many different issues. Working with stress can lead to several health issues too. Like a constant headache and sleeping disorders too.

2. Increase Stress Level:

 Working along with studies gives you opportunities but on the other hand, it can increase stress level too. There can be days where you have to do overwork, which sometimes doesn’t allow a student to pay attention towards his studies.

3. Lack of Concentration:

 Taking in every perspective of working along there can be chances where you have deadlines and exams at the same time. Might be you’ll pay attention to studies but then your works piles up, which is a bit unprofessional.

4. No Time for Other Activities:

Maintaining studies and working along is a bit hard but it can be balanced. These two activities consume more of your time when you are not studying you are doing office work. When you are doing office work you aren’t studying. These two will consume much of your work which means you will not be having time for other activities. You won’t be having time for family and friends.

5. Can Lead To Bad Grades

 It needs your time, which affects your main aim of life i.e. studies. It does hamper your studies, it does affect your grades. Might be you don’t find time for studies and this can affect your working too. You may have mood swings for not paying attention to both.

Studying and working, both are two different phases of life. Handling them that too at the same time obviously require more energy and dedication. Studies are important in a student life but experiencing work culture along with it can be a blessing. It improves your knowledge. But balancing it along studies is a bit difficult because a small mistake can change a lot. Workings in the age where you are still a student have advantages and disadvantages. It’s how you handle it.

review_title: Lamar is a wonderful place to work and they are on the Gulf of Mexico and pay well!
pros: People are friendly and supportive.Environment is positive. Cost of living is not high. Many good places to et asnd tour museums and art galleries.
cons: the weather is very humid and you never have a good hair day.You are 45 minutes to Louisiana state line and there is so much to do in Louisiana. You are 80 miles from Houston and you would have tons of great things to do there also. Beaches are close and you can take a ferry from Bolivar to Galveston for the day or the weekend, and the boat ride is fun with dolphibs following the ferry.

pros: Faculty are team oriented, efficient, and lively. Faculty truly love their jobs and make the work environment a fun place.
cons:
Older admins hoard work for job security so it leaves little for the student assistants to work on. Often picks and chooses what they will and will not allow assistants to do. 
Physical labor required most of the time because admins have health issues preventing them or they just don't care to.

pros: Some really great professors and programs. Most faculty and staff are interested in helping students succeed. I actually love my job and the people I work with.
cons: The financial aid department is a great source of complaints. Students complain about the office asking repeatedly for the same forms without explanation. Pay is low compared to just about anything — with a Master's degree I earn about $18K less than I did as a public school teacher in the same city.

review_title: Progressive university that is working to build up its graduate and online programs.
pros: Benefits, support, tenure for full-time, flexibility for part-time, local feel, growing online programs, award-winning engineering and deaf education, growing graduate programs
cons: predominantly a commuter school, graduate classes are sometimes too small to maintain, parking can be a problem (or can result in long walks)

review_title: Research and quality of education is really impressive.
pros: The university has been nationally recognized for the quality of its core curriculum and the diversity of its student body. Small class sizes and a low student-to-faculty ratio allow students to build meaningful relationships with expert faculty who truly care about their success. Lamar was recently designated as a Carnegie Doctoral Research University, one of only 29 public schools in the nation to receive that designation.  LU has more than 300 students enrolled in doctoral programs.  Lamar University has a 19:1 student to faculty ratio.
cons: It requires more faculty in engineering departments and it should set high standard for graduate students admission.

job_title: Assistant Program Director in Beaumont, TX
pros:
-Mostly great people to work with, helpful and nice
-flexible time available to deal with family needs
- Tuition program for spouses and dependents
- Decent benefits
- freedom to pursue any endeavor or project and work yourself to death with no support or recognition or overtime that you can use to get a better position somewhere else.
- great local restaurants and venues for live music 
-close to the beach and Gulf of Mexico, close to some great rivers and state parks, forests
cons:
-archaic instructional procedures, well behind other universities of comparable size
- large number of folks not from the area and they do not have a strong community relationship - aloof to building relationships about anything other than sports and even that is pretty weak.
– instructional pay is low, local K12 school districts pay more with a bachelors degree
- student payroll is low and students constantly have to choose between working on campus or off campus. Most work off campus because pay is better and can actually support themselves. Seriously affects the development and progress of many LU programs.
- run-down neighborhood surrounds campus; high crime, high poverty. very unsafe after dark off campus. Campus cops do a good job, but they can't be everywhere. City doesn't make much developments for the area.
-campus is adjacent to a refinery complex - air usually has a very funky smell kinda like pepper - I know of co-workers and candidates who quit or refused positions because of air quality issues.
- Seems to be a lot of turnover in some admin and academic areas
– campus has a lot of long-term employees that are not utilized appropriately - admin will take joe blow off the street before listening to the employee that has experience in the department- doesn't apply to my area, but I observed this in a lot of other other areas and heard a lot of complaints.
- scarcity of decent housing options in Beaumont

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Beaumont, TX
pros: There are excellent opportunities for any area of computer science research which can be used for you thesis or graduate project.  The professors are very help and have expertise in most all fields from wireless communications and sensor to neural networks and distributed operating systems used in cloud computing.
cons: It is difficult to think of any 'cons'.  For you research you made need to use university resources which are subject of open hours of the building.

pros: Working for the university ensures that every day is fresh and exciting. There are always diverse problems to solve. Everyone that i worked with there was friendly and very helpful.
cons: There are no benefits such as health insurance or milage compensation provided for part-time workers. It is fairly common to work more hours than you get paid for due to the maximum number of hours being 19.5.

review_title: You'll either love it or hate it
pros: Great place to work as your first job because it provides the stability and pace that is usually appreciated by new graduates to plan and execute their future advancements career wise. Lamar University provides fantastic benefits package with great health insurance. It has a small college town atmosphere where painting the town in cardinal red is not uncommon. There are events all through the year that will make you feel at home. Other benefits that are small but help include free parking facilities for staff members (so you do not have to fight with students for parking spots). A good place to work I'd say.
cons: Salaries are not up to par with other universities but the cost of living in Beaumont isn't that high so that makes up for it. Career advancement is very limited with human resources taking a good share of decision making in their own hands (even though they have no idea about the employee). There are no performance related bonuses or promotions. It is a typical government office. Senior Management some how feels that they need to be in the limelight all the time as opposed to the usual students who are in the limelight in most universities. At first this is not a bother but it gets to you after a while. If you don't believe me, pick up a Cadence magazine and count the ratio of Sr. Mgmt. photos to those of students and you will know what I am talking about.

job_title: Student Assistant in Port Neches, TX
pros: One of the biggest advantages of working in the chemistry department is being able to have a good Student/Professor connection. This is very important especially if you will be taking a few chemistry classes. The pay is also above average
cons: one of my biggest problems is that sometimes I am the only student assistant and One of the biggest advantages of working in the chemistry department is being able to have a good Student/Professor connection. This is very important especially if you will be taking a few chemistry classes. The pay is also above average

review_title: Research Lab Administrator College of Business Lamar University
job_title: Assistant Lab Administrator in Beaumont, TX
pros: Here in Lamar, you really get to learn many new troubleshooting techniques related to networks, hardware,etc. You also get good exposure to maintain the servers that are accessed by the College of Business.
cons: The staff is really not supportive. Once you leave the job and ask for any recommendation for the work you did for them, they escape from giving it.

pros: Good benefits (5 classes a year for free for employees, free health insurance), made some good friends, easy to keep your job if you actually do it, a fair amount of inner community involvement
cons: Little room for advancement, a lot of people don't enjoy their jobs here, they're behind on technology as a whole (though not far behind), Beaumont is considered a miserable place by most, Lamar is it's own city that's very disconnected from the rest of Beaumont

review_title: Great Job, Finance department needs work
pros: Great people, great environment, glad I could work as a student
cons: Every semester as a student worker, a new F3.2 had to be filed for each student. Every semester mine would get lost and I had to wait over a month to get paid. I would say once or twice was a coincidence, but every semester. Not cool! I have bills, I kept having to live off my savings until it was fixed each time.

job_title: Front Desk Assistant in Beaumont, TX
pros: I work as a front desk assistant in the STARS department at LU and it's great. The people are very friendly and cheerful, and since it is work-study, they encourage you to do your very best. They are very understanding if you can't make it to work and love to see you everyday!
cons: No cons that I could specify, other than the upset students you have to deal with, the job is pretty gravy

review_title: Fun place to work Nice atomosphere
job_title: Client Service Specialist in Beaumont, TX
pros: Lots of verticals to get into so if you ever wanted to try a related career path or something new there are plenty of opportunities.
cons: The pay rate and raises are not as competitive as I would like but that goes in cycles so this too could improve.

pros: Great staff. Especially the professors are so helpful and understanding. You may get salary incremental based on the funding of your professor.
cons: Number of graduate students is increasing exponentially and is getting beyond the capacity of the department. Difficult to manage and evaluate students.

review_title: Center of Innovation, Commercialization and Entrepreneurship
pros: Speaking specifically for the CICE, it's a very open work culture. Sometimes slow, sometimes fast-paced but always reasonable. I would encourage others to work here if they have a passion for innovation. I think that the CICE is already doing amazing things and the rest of Lamar isn't far behind.
cons: Lamar University is not very far along in developing its infrastructure for supporting innovative/entrepreneurial endeavors. It might take time.

pros: Students are great and appreciative when you take an interest in their education.  New administration has continued campus improvements and these changes are exciting for current and incoming employees and students.
cons: Communication between higher administration and faculty and staff is not always reliable and often changes are made without updates sent to faculty and staff in a timely manner (or not at all).

review_title: Fulfilling and helpful for student employees.
pros: Helped supplement my student income while gaining experience in the field of study I was pursuing.
cons: Not a lot of hours, nor money. Student employees are not recognized as full fledged staff and therefore receive no affiliated benefits.

pros: If you are a student assistant, they will work around your schedule. If you get hired by the right department, you can get incredibly connected with the higher ups. I know of one person who got a recommendation from Lamar's President for a job.
cons: 20 hours max a week. Don't expect to be rich if you have bills to pay.

job_title: Assistant Director, Career & Professional Development in Beaumont, TX
pros: The office has a very flexible environment. Also, the interaction with students are rewarding. We have a supportive team, great people to work with! Professional development opportunities are provided and encouraged.
cons: University culture is behind but changing. Having to do more with less is a struggle all departments have on campus, but still a good place to work.

job_title: Assistant to Systems Administrator in Beaumont, TX
pros:
Very good hands on experience. I was also responsible, with two other co-workers, to prepare and present a Linux workshop every semester to new Grad students.
I dealt with hardware, network, and several Operating Systems issues. The system was well maintained, so there were opportunities to work on other research projects while at work.
cons: There are cons being student worker here.

pros: Good facilities, great engineering school.
cons: The administration is awful. Most of the upper admins fly by the seat of their pants. Instead of being proactive, they are reactive. Policies are written after things occur, rather than to foreseeing possible problems. They pay is horrible. The benefits are very good. Very rarely do you get a question answered as an employee without receiving the run-around. Administration takes days, and sometimes weeks to return phone calls or emails.

pros: I really enjoyed my time with STAIRSTEP. It's a great program that deserves more recognition.
cons: I think the 20 hour limit is very restricting for students as it adds another layer of complexity onto holding a job at Lamar.

review_title: A great job for a student
pros: I worked as a student assistant at the read honors college and the hours were really flexible and it was fun to work with the staff.
cons: I mean you won't make a crazy amount and there's not much to do but that's what student jobs are like.

pros: I have worked more than one student job at Lamar and at both they have always worked with my schedule. Both jobs have provided me with valuable experience but they have also allowed for me to complete my schoolwork when needed.
cons: There is a restriction of 19.5 hours per week.

review_title: Growing university with great opportunities for growth given the fact that it is in proximity to the oil industry.
pros: Multi cultural, student friendly, growth opportunities.
cons: Some staff can be bias towards certain people.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Beaumont, TX
pros: Full-time employees are allowed to take up to 5 courses per calendar year that the university pays for (if they pertain to your job or your chosen major). They also offer LUTAP which helps pay for part of your spouse's and dependant's college tuition.
cons: Very political, very few opportunities for advancement

pros: I learned a lot in Marketing, which happened to be my degree as well, and had a wonderful team around me. The office culture is nice and supportive, and they worked with my class schedule easily.

pros: Great supervisor, very understanding and approachable. Hours were fixed, but could usually be rescheduled if a conflict arose.

pros: Very laid back. The people here are good to work with. Most employees are excited about teaching. Continuing education is offered.
